page.title: 11Churches in the Village.
page.content: { St.Hilda's}(Anglican) has a Norman font and much 13 Century carving. The parish registers go back to 1690. The Churchyard has several interesting gravestones: one made from an old mill grindstone. There is also the stump of a Saxon Cross. A stained glass window commemorates Dick Thompson's Grandparents (Village builders for 300 years). The faces are taken from photographs of the couple. The resident vicar also serves Oswaldkirk and from 1985 Gilling too. { St.Benedict's}(Catholic). Much of the furnishing is the work of the Mouseman Robert Thompson of Kilburn. His first commission was for an oak cross for the war memorial. A monk from Ampleforth Abbey serves the Parish. { Methodists.}There is now only one Chapel in use; a second having been recently sold.
